note.text: Perspective-taking refers to being able to see situations, actions, and motivations from someone else's perspective. When individuals interact with their counterparts, they should be trying to see things from their counterpart's point of view. This will help to build understanding and reduce frustration and miscommunication. When taking perspective, three questions should be considered:

- How do I see me?
- How do I see my counterpart?
- How does my counterpart see me?
